t4.NeuralNet

Class Layer

  • java.lang.Object
    • t4.NeuralNet.Layer

  • public class Layer
extends java.lang.Object
    A Layer represents a collection of Neurons in one of the NeuralNet's various layers.
    Author:
    Teddy

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String name 
      protected Neuron[] neurons 
      protected NeuralNet nn 
      protected Layer previous

      Constructs a new Layer with a given number of Neurons.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected double[] getValues()
      Return an array of values for this Layer, corresponding to each of the Neuron's values.
      protected boolean isInputLayer()
      Checks whether this Layer has a previous Layer, or if it is the first Layer
      protected void setValues(double[] values)
      Sets the values for each of the Neurons in this Layer
      java.lang.String toString() 
      protected void updateValues()
      Update the values for each of the Neurons in this Layer as the weighted sum of the input to each Neuron.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Layer

        public Layer(NeuralNet nn,
             int numNeurons,
             java.lang.String name)
        Constructs a new Layer with a given number of Neurons. Initializes the Neurons with default values (see NeuralNet) and connects them with Bridges to the neurons in the previous layer as well as the NeuralNet bias.
        Parameters:
        nn - NeuralNet this layer should be added to
        numNeurons - Number of Neurons in this Layer
        name - Name of this layer

    • Method Detail

      • isInputLayer

        protected boolean isInputLayer()
        Checks whether this Layer has a previous Layer, or if it is the first Layer
        Returns:
        Whether this Layer has a previous Layer

      • updateValues

        protected void updateValues()
        Update the values for each of the Neurons in this Layer as the weighted sum of the input to each Neuron. If a Neuron does not have input values, its value is set to 0.

      • getValues

        protected double[] getValues()
        Return an array of values for this Layer, corresponding to each of the Neuron's values.
        Returns:
        Array of values for this Layer's Neurons

      • setValues

        protected void setValues(double[] values)
                  throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Sets the values for each of the Neurons in this Layer
        Parameters:
        values - Array of values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If number of values != number of Neurons

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
